stories.title: The Silver Currency of Cannabis Country (2019)
Google Play crackdown makes Amazon, Barnes and Noble pull digital purchases

stories.text:
Is the UX research discipline just hype? It seems that the tech community accepts certain dogma to realease products "MVP, agile, user centered design, etc".

Yet if there was a good process, why does the tech industry follow UX principles that keep pumping mainly low quality products, while Apple is the opposite?

Apple's secrecy does not help. The few articles on google were either outdated (Job's legacy) or blog opinions and speculations. The few UX researchers on Linkedin were Apple contractors, with some roles opening recently in Austin.

What are they doing right that most tech companies miss? Or is it not design, but a distinctive leadership and strategy that works?

Ex: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=o3uR6IDSHSM

Would love to hear from insiders if possible, thanks.
